text: that was helpful indeed. Thanks for pointing that one out. I was quickly going crazy

I'm trying to get the bounceInDown effect to work on my temp home page



<http://certasiteprotected-5653766.hs-sites.com/>



I'm using css3-animate-it and have the css loading in the header module (that seems to be working fine) and the js loading just before the body tag in my homepage.html coded template.



The css animation loads but none of the javascript functionality is working and I can't figure out why that would be. Jquery is loading in the head of the site and that is the only other dependency as far as I know.



<https://jackonthe.net/css3animateit/>
Any help is much appreciated. Thanks.
I can see the h1 animate and the I can see the classes flash in devtools. I have to admit though I”m super familiar with this functionality
Maybe try putting it to `slowest` to see if that allows us to see the animation?
I've added slowest. reload and give it a try. The animation happens but the text disappears after it loads the first time.
I believe the js is supposed to keep it from disappearing according to this thread:
See first comment at bottom of this page: <http://devtuts.online/how-to-use-css3-animate-it/>
That comment leads me to believe the js is not loading properly therefore it's not doing what it's supposed to do.

To quote that comment, it says: "Hi Abdul, It sounds like you haven’t loaded in the JavaScript files properly. What happens is the CSS will hide it on load so you don’t have it snapping in and out. Then when the JavaScript loads or when it comes into view, it will slide into view.

Without the JavaScript though it just won’t appear.

Let me know if that helps :slightly_smiling_face:"

hmm only other thing I can think of is that you don’t have the `animated` class as a direct child of the `animatedParent` I don’t know enough about the library to know if that will change things, but it might be something worth trying
Just tried that. Didn't work either.
shoot ok, I’m out of ideas here, I’m going to try and start fresh with this on Monday if you don’t find a solution in the meantime
